recipe.title: Crème Brûlée
recipe.description: Silky vanilla custard with caramelized sugar crust

on_enter.say: Right, let's preheat the oven to one hundred forty degrees celsius, which is about two hundred seventy-five degrees fahrenheit. This will set the stage for our lovely crème brûlée.

steps.descr: Heat cream with vanilla pod until just boiling
steps.instructions: Heat cream with vanilla pod until just boiling

on_enter.say: Now, let's gently heat the cream with the vanilla pod until it's just about to boil. You'll know it's ready when you see those tiny bubbles forming around the edges.

steps.descr: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale
steps.instructions: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now let's whisk the egg yolks with the sugar until they're pale and creamy. This is where the magic begins!

steps.descr: Pour hot cream over eggs, whisking constantly
steps.instructions: Pour hot cream over eggs, whisking constantly

on_enter.say: Now, let's carefully pour that hot cream over the egg mixture, whisking constantly. This will create a beautiful, silky custard.
Let's strain our lovely custard into ramekins. This will ensure it's smooth and free of any lumps.

steps.descr: Bake in water bath for 30-35 minutes
steps.instructions: Bake in water bath for 30-35 minutes

on_enter.say: Time to bake these beauties in a water bath for about thirty to thirty-five minutes. This gentle cooking will give us that perfect custard texture. Remember, it should have a slight wobble when it's done.

steps.descr: Chill 4 hours, sprinkle with sugar and blowtorch
steps.instructions: Chill 4 hours, sprinkle with sugar and blowtorch

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Once cooled, let's chill the custard for four hours. Then, sprinkle with sugar and use a blowtorch to create that iconic caramelized crust. Enjoy your crème brûlée!

notes.text: Don't skip the water bath - it ensures smooth custard. The custard should wobble slightly. Chill thoroughly before brûléeing.
